raw_response.summary_short: MCA Denver presents contemporary art exhibitions and related public programs; upcoming shows include Roni Horn and Deborah Jack (Sep 2025–Feb 2026).
raw_response.summary_long: Museum of Contemporary Art Denver (MCA Denver) is a contemporary art museum in Denver focused on rotating exhibitions and public programs. The museum’s listings highlight major exhibition presentations such as “Roni Horn: Water, Water on the Wall, You’re the Fairest of Them All” and “Deborah Jack: the haunting of estuaries…an (after)math of confluence,” both scheduled Sep 12, 2025–Feb 15, 2026, alongside artist talks and conversations tied to current shows.

collection_highlights.title: Rotating contemporary art exhibitions
collection_highlights.description: Programming emphasizes temporary exhibitions rather than a documented permanent-collection focus in the provided evidence.

collection_highlights.title: Roni Horn exhibition (Sep 12, 2025–Feb 15, 2026)
collection_highlights.description: “Roni Horn: Water, Water on the Wall, You’re the Fairest of Them All.”

collection_highlights.title: Deborah Jack exhibition (Sep 12, 2025–Feb 15, 2026)
collection_highlights.description: “Deborah Jack: the haunting of estuaries…an (after)math of confluence.”

collection_highlights.title: Artist talk / conversation programming
collection_highlights.description: Example: “Deborah Jack: On Water, Memory, & Resistant Geographies” (Jan 29) tied to the exhibition.

visitor_tips: Plan around the exhibition calendar; major shows listed run Sep 12, 2025–Feb 15, 2026.
Check the events schedule for artist conversations tied to exhibitions (e.g., Deborah Jack talk on Jan 29).
If visiting more than once, consider membership for repeat access and shop/café discounts (as advertised).
raw_response.best_for: Travelers seeking rotating contemporary art exhibitions plus artist talks and public programs.

tour_planning_scores.scoring_rationale: Evidence emphasizes contemporary exhibitions and related public programs, supporting a high contemporary score. No permanent-collection depth is documented in the snippet, so collection depth is kept modest while educational value is supported by scheduled artist conversations.

sources_consulted: user_provided_evidence: mcadenver.org website text snippet (exhibitions and events listings)
